subject: Investing
title: Private Real Estate Funds
description: A fast breakdown of Private Real Estate Funds for builders.

hook.text: A pension fund invested $10 million into a private real estate fund and earned 14% annually for a decade.

buildup.text: Private funds pool institutional and accredited capital to buy portfolios of properties.

discovery.text: They offer diversification across many buildings but require high minimumsâ€”often $250K or more.

twist.text: Fees can reach 2% management plus 20% of profits, eating deeply into net returns.

climax.text: Performance data is self-reported and less transparent than public REIT returns.

punchline.text: Private funds promise exclusivity; make sure the returns justify the price tag.

quiz.question: What is a common fee structure for private real estate funds?
